content.description:
Sim Sala Bim climbs a short overhang via painfully good edges.

Sit start with a left hand sidepull-edge, a right hand edge-pinch, a right foot pasted on the wall, and left toe-hook. From there, make a quick dyno to a right hand edge, follow with the left hand, place a heel, then begin traversing right on edges for a few feet, then crank onto the slab using the edges, and finish up the remainder for an easy mantle.
content.protection: A couple of pads will work well. The landing is very good, despite a few rocks that guard the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the west face overhang of Zoltar.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand edge and a right hand sidepull. From there, pull up through the edges using the dihedral to your advantage, reach the lip, and mantle on top.
content.protection: A pad will work. The landing is good.
content.location: It climbs the north facing dihedral of Zoltar.

content.description: Sit start with left and right hand edges and a left heel hook. From there, move to the rail, match, move up and slight right to a shelf, match, reach the lip, and mantle on top.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work. The landing is good, but there are a few rocks present, and it is slightly sloping away at the end.
content.location: It climbs the northwest face of Zoltar. Actually a separate rocks that sits just below Zoltar's northwest face.
